verses.text: Every friend saith, I am his friend also: But there is a friend, \add which is\add* only a friend in name.
Is it not a grief unto death, When a companion and friend is turned to an enemy?
O wicked imagination, whence camest thou in To cover the earth with deceit?
\add There is\add* a companion, \add which\add* rejoiceth in the prosperity of a friend, But in the time of trouble will be against \add him\add*.
\add There is\add* a companion, \add which\add* helpeth his friend for the belly, And taketh up the buckler against the enemy.
Forget not thy friend in thy mind, And be not unmindful of him in thy riches.
Every counseller extolleth counsel; But there is some that counselleth for himself.
Beware of a counseller, And know before what need he \add hath;\add* (For he will counsel for himself) Lest he cast the lot upon thee,
And say unto thee, Thy way \add is\add* good: And \add afterward\add* he stand on the other \add side\add*, to see what shall befall thee.
Consult not with one that suspecteth thee: And hide \add thy\add* counsel from such as envy thee.

\add Neither consult\add* with a woman touching her of whom she is jealous; Neither with a coward in matters of war; \add Nor\add* with a merchant concerning exchange; Nor with a buyer of selling; \add Nor\add* with an envious man of thankfulness; Nor with an unmerciful man touching kindness; \add Nor\add* with the slothful for any work; Nor with a hireling for a year, of finishing \add work;\add* \add Nor\add* with an idle servant of much business: Hearken not unto these in any matter of counsel.
But be continually with a godly man, Whom thou knowest to keep the commandments of the Lord, Whose mind \add is\add* according to thy mind, And will sorrow with thee, if thou shalt miscarry.
And let the counsel of \add thine own\add* heart stand: For there is no \add man\add* more faithful unto thee than it.
For a manâ€™s mind is sometime wont to tell \add him more\add* Than seven watchmen, that sit above in a high tower.
And above all this pray to the most High, That he will direct thy way in truth.
\add Let\add* reason \add go\add* before every enterprise, And counsel before every action.
The countenance \add is\add* a sign of changing of the heart.
Four manner \add of things\add* appear: good and evil, life and death: But the tongue ruleth over them continually.
There is one \add that is\add* wise and teacheth many, And \add yet\add* is unprofitable to himself.
There is one that sheweth wisdom in words, \add and is\add* hated: He shall be destitute of all food.
For grace is not given him from the Lord; Because he is deprived of all wisdom.
\add Another\add* is wise to himself; And the fruits of understanding \add are\add* commendable in his mouth.
A wise man instructeth his people; And the fruits of his understanding fail not.
A wise man shall be filled with blessing; And all they that see \add him\add* shall count him happy.
The days of the life of man \add may be\add* numbered: But the days of Israel \add are\add* innumerable.
A wise \add man\add* shall inherit glory among his people, And his name shall be perpetual.
\add My\add* son, prove thy soul in thy life, And see what \add is\add* evil for it, And give not \add that\add* unto it.
For all \add things\add* are not profitable for all \add men\add*, Neither hath every soul pleasure in every \add thing\add*.
Be not unsatiable in any dainty thing, Nor too greedy upon meats:
For excess of meats bringeth sickness, And surfeiting will turn into choler.
By surfeiting have many perished; But he that taketh heed prolongeth \add his\add* life.
